item.title: Dijkstra's algorithm
item.description: Breadth-first search, but with a twist. Finds the shortest path for a weighted [[Graph]]. Links Dijkstra’s Algorithm

item.title: Graph
item.description: How to store You can use a [[Hash table|Hash map]]. Keys are vertices, values are children. You can also use adjacency matrix.

item.title: Python
item.description: [[Python quirks]] #todo Combinations - Rosetta Code (Python example). Really worth attention. Didn’t know [i + 1:] syntax is valid Links Learn Python - Free Interactive Python Tutorial See also [[Awesome Python]] [[Python package management]]

item.title: Go
item.description: A cool language. Garbage-collected, duh. Links Making a Go program 42% faster with a one character change â€¢ Harry Marr Go Slices are Fat Pointers by [[null program (blog)]] 12 Angry Gophers

item.title: JavaScript
item.description: JavaScript is a prototype-based language: there are no classes and objects are created using a cloning process. JavaScript is also a dynamic programming language which means that properties can be easily added or removed from an object after its instantiation.

item.title: Hash set
item.description: Links scratch/set32 - an example of integer hash set in C

item.title: Babashka
item.description: [[Clojure]] for scripting, aimed to replace [[Bash]]. Built-in variables *command-line-args* - the name says it all *input* - stdin, for scripts only.
